title: Frozen Mallet Balance
body:
I think that it is difficult for someone to argue that the slow on Frozen Mallet is anything short of oppressive. 

An immediate 40% slow on-hit for melee champions, or a 30% slow for ranged champions is rough when they already have the ability to stick to you. 

Now, I completely understand that this is the whole purpose of the item, but I feel that it should really be a bit more forgiving at first, then reward the player for sticking to the target with sustained damage, opposed to landing a single attack. 

I feel that this could be accomplished if the passive accumulated stacks on it's user from landing basic attacks against enemy champions. 

My original idea would simply be to stack an additional 5% slow onto an enemy champion per stack applied to them, but as I understand it, slows do not stack. 

My theory to work around this would be to apply a new slow on-hit based on the number of stacks accumulated on the player. 

So for example, when the player initially attacks an enemy champion they will have 0 stacks, and will therefor apply a slow of 10% immediately. 

Melee champions will accumulate 2 stacks per attack, and ranged champions will accumulate 1 stack which will increase the slow applied to the next enemy champion (can be the same champion) on-hit by 5% per stack. 20% for melee, 15% for ranged. 

This will accumulate to a maximum of 6 stacks for melee champions and 4 stacks for ranged champions, to a maximum of 40% slow after 3 melee attacks, or a 30% slow after 4 ranged attacks, against an enemy champion for 1.5 seconds. 

Stacks will last for up to 5 seconds without attacking an enemy champion before dropping off. 

The thing that I don't really like about this is that it would mean that a player could attack champion A until they have reached full stacks, and then immediately attack champion B and apply the full slow. I ultimately find this to be acceptable since they would need to have been in combat already within the previous 5 seconds, but I would personally prefer if it could be applied on a per enemy champion basis.

The thing is... frozen mallet lost a decent chunk of damage recently and got an hp buff in return. Few champs build this into their kit -- used to just be gnar, then people started adding it to aa bruisers in top and jungle to stick to adc's and midlaners. While I agree (i've been on all sides of this item) that it can be oppressive if you are a squishy (or 0 damage tank) getting run down by a fed enemy bruiser 1v1, I believe this is not a flaw of the item at all. There are just as many times where you can be that bruiser needing to dive the enemy backline in a teamfight, but you get peeled either because you don't have frozen mallet or in spite of having it due to chained enemy cc. If the passive were stacking rather than 40% to start with, you would literally have about a 0% chance to run down the enemy adc or mid if their team peels decently and they have any intelligence about kiting. Also, I believe most scenarios apart from teamfights would not let the person slowed by frozen mallet escape even if the slow ramped up (rumble e actually stacks fyi - side note) rather than applying 40% slow to begin with. Yeah there are those 1 or 2 exceptions, but in 90% of cases I don't think a ramping slow would make a difference.
